resources.string: I\'m a boy playing on the seashore, seeing the ocean of truth lay all undiscovered before me. I\'m starving for knowledge, always eager to learn and determined to convert information into action. The plan is to be another micro incremental pawn that strives for the betterment of humanity.
I exhibit perfectionist behaviour. I try to control it and not overthink stuff or I wouldn\'t get anything done. This however doesn\'t mean my work is perfect, I\'m open to constructive criticism.

"\u2713 In Pakistan I noticed street lights staying on at dawn and at times even later. We were facing an energy crisis back then and this was an event that encouraged us to be innovative and come up with ideas to sustain energy. The basic idea was to turn the street lights automatically when the photoelectric sensor received sufficient light when transitioning from night to day."

✓ Java for Blackberry SDK 7.1 
✓ Java for Android
✓ Sencha Touch 2 (HTML5)
✓ SMTP Mail Configurations
✓ CronJobs and Task Schedulers for Auto Execution of the Scripts at a given time.

\u2713 Designed a Library management system from scratch \n\u2713 Made an easy and flexible UI for both the administrator and the user. The issue of concurrent loaning of the same book was handled and fines were given out on late returns.

"✓ Professor control features added including grading students, marking attendance. 
✓ Student features included viewing marks, GPA, attendance, courses registered and registering courses. 
✓ Admin features included adding courses, assigning teachers to courses and limiting the maximum number of students in a particular course. 
✓ Checks added such that students wouldn't be able to register if seats were full. Student can request to register in a course of his preference and if a seat is freed he is notified.

\u2713 Notepad designed for Visual Studio console using linked lists and establishing connections in all four directions \n\u2713 Basic functionalities of a notepad such as read,write and moving with the cursor implemented.

A parametric effort estimation model for mobile apps
Why did I choose to join this society:

"\u2713" Joining a society gives the opportunity to develop Networking skills, Not only did I socialize with more people as a consequence, I also learned how to function as a unit and improved the overall experience for everyone attending the events.
"\u2713" Client based company, so considering the requirements from clients and keeping in point latest technology at that time I used above technology stack.
